00002 #define _RESOURCE_MONITOR_DEF_H_
00003 
00004 #include <vector>
00005 #include <iostream>
00006 
00007 /*
00008     This class contains a abstract resource monitor used to keep track of resources loaded into the system
00009     Used by classes such as the texture monitor
00010     Used as a template for most other resource monitors in the engine
00011 */
00012 
00013 struct resource_monitor_entry
00014 {
00015     /* The abstract class stores all entities as void* the resource monitor uses the template to typecast them back */
00016     void* m_Entity;
00017 
00018     /* Simple reference count system for now */
00019     unsigned int m_boundCount;
00020 
00021     /* Name used to identify the resource */
00022     std::string m_ResourceName;
00023 };
00024 
00025 class ResourceMonitor
00026 {
00027 protected:
00028 
00029     std::vector<resource_monitor_entry> m_resourceList;
00030 
00031     /* Free the entity specified. Overload to perform specific free calls (Like typecast or calling specific destroy function on it)*/
00032 
00033     virtual void f_freeEntity(void* m_Entity);
00034 
00035     /* Virtual function, loads specified resource, overload with specific load routine */
00036     virtual void* f_loadEntity(std::string Name);
00037 
00038     /* Free's the entity at the index specified (Removes it from the list and calls f_freeEntity on its data if there are no other binds) */
00039 
00040     void f_freeIndex(unsigned int i);
00041 
00042     /* Adds a entity to the resource list */
00043 
00044     void f_addEntity(std::string Filename, void* Entity);
00045 
00046     /* Functions to get and free entitys, protected because they should always be called from other functions within the child class */
00047 
00048     void* rmGetResource(std::string Resource);
00049     void rmReleaseResource(void* Resource);
00050 
00051 public:
00052     ResourceMonitor();
00053     virtual ~ResourceMonitor();
00054 
00055 };

00057 #endif //_RESOURCE_MONITOR_DEF_H_
